div.h4: Welcome to Hanover-Horton School District where we are creating a better world, one student at a time.
div.p: At Hanover-Horton, we are committed to academic excellence. Our graduating class of 2019 had nearly 60% graduate with at least a 3.0 GPA. As a group, they qualified for over $2 million in scholarships and grants. Our high school offers students the opportunity to take college and Advanced Placement courses, participate in our engineering classes and choose from a wide variety of elective courses. Hanover-Horton High School has consistently scored among the areas best on the ACT and SAT for several years in a row!
Hanover-Horton Middle School has shown consistent gains on recent state tests. Students are able to take classes in engineering, art, computers, health…

div.h4: Welcome to Hanover-Horton School District where we are creating a better world, one student at a time.
div.p: At Hanover-Horton, we are committed to academic excellence. Our graduating class of 2019 had nearly 60% graduate with at least a 3.0 GPA. As a group, they qualified for over $2 million in scholarships and grants. Our high school offers students the opportunity to take college and Advanced Placement courses, participate in our engineering classes and choose from a wide variety of elective courses. Hanover-Horton High School has consistently scored among the areas best on the ACT and SAT for several years in a row!

div.style: border-bottom: 0px solid #fff; -webkit-border-radius: px; -moz-border-radius: px; border-radius: px;

p.span:
We are thrilled to continue to offer free meals to any child 18 and under throughout our closure! This is not need based and is open to anyone who stops by!
Beginning next week, meals will be available for pick up on two days each week. Stop by on Tuesday and/or Friday to pick up breakfast and lunch for your students! Pick up is at Hanover-Horton Elementary from 11:00 a.m.-12:30 p.m. When you stop by, you can pick up multiple days worth of food!

img.alt:
We are thrilled to continue to offer free meals to any child 18 and under throughout our closure! This is not need based and is open to anyone who stops by!
Beginning next week, meals will be available for pick up on two days each week. Stop by on Tuesday and/or Friday to pick up breakfast and lunch for your students! Pick up is at Hanover-Horton Elementary from 11:00 a.m.-12:30 p.m. When you stop by, you can pick up multiple days worth of food!

div.style: border-bottom: 0px solid #fff; -webkit-border-radius: px; -moz-border-radius: px; border-radius: px;

p.span: Hanover-Horton Elementary is having an online Book Fair! Shop now until April 28th with free shipping on orders over $25.00! In need of some educational resources to keep busy? Check out the wide range of books for preschool-12th grade, educational toys, crafts, science kits and so much more!

div.span: Visit our school's homepage to hear the latest Book Fair news, RSVP for events, sign up to volunteer, and more!

div.style: border-bottom: 0px solid #fff; -webkit-border-radius: px; -moz-border-radius: px; border-radius: px;

p.span: It is never too late to apply for the free/reduced lunch program! Many other programs, including the Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer Program, are based off of your free and reduced lunch application. Have you or someone you know been impacted by the recent closures, had a job change or other life events? We encourage you to apply! Follow the link to apply now or stop by the Elementary School during meal pick up times to grab a paper application!

div.span: Apply for free or reduced school meal benefits online, quickly and confidentially, from the convenience of your home.

div.style: border-bottom: 0px solid #fff; -webkit-border-radius: px; -moz-border-radius: px; border-radius: px;

p.span: Emma Davis is still at the top of her game! Remember this 2015 Bowling State Champion? She has now been named as All-American Honorable Mention by the National Collegiate Bowling Coaches Association. She was also named First-Team All American by the Club Team Bowling Coaches Association. How amazing! Emma, we are so proud of you and all of your continued accomplishments!

div.span: Emma Davis was named CTBCA MVP earlier this year.

div.p: This is AWESOME!! Way to go, Emma!!

div.style: border-bottom: 0px solid #fff; -webkit-border-radius: px; -moz-border-radius: px; border-radius: px;

p.span:
We would like to congratulate Ella Cure on her decision to commit to Lawrence Technological University to study Architectural Engineering and play volleyball.
Way to go, Ella!!!

img.alt: We would like to congratulate Ella Cure on her decision to commit to Lawrence Technological University to study Architectural Engineering and play volleyball. Way to go, Ella!!!

div.p: Congratulations Ella on a fantastic decision. I wish you the best. 💋💗
Congratulations Bean! They’re very lucky to have you there! ❤️🏐
I thought she was going to study Agricultural Engineering....at least that’s what our great announcer Dennis Lashley said....Congrats Ella!!!!!

That is so
Awesome Ella, congratulations girl!
Way to go Ella!!! You will do fantastic!! Proud of you!!

div.span: During this unprecedented time, I find it important to hope for best case scenarios while understanding possible worst case ones. With that in mind, I can see a best case scenario exist that we are back in school after our normal spring break. Athletics may happen quickly after that. Please take int...

p.span: All Winter Sports are Suspended Immediately

p.a: All Winter Sports are Suspended Immediately

div.span: The MHSAA has suspended all winter tournaments effective Thursday afternoon. The MHSAA will re-evaluate the situation and provide press releases as updates warrant. This means that the boys district final game scheduled for tomorrow against Homer at Concord is postponed. The MHSAA ban does not affec...

div.span: We're excited to welcome Sundance as a continued, official partner of the Comets athletic website! WHO THEY ARE: Sundance is a Taco-Bell franchisee owner, owning & operating 175 restaurants in the United States! They are looking to grow & improve their team, focusing on customer experience & employe...

div.style: border-bottom: 0px solid #fff; -webkit-border-radius: px; -moz-border-radius: px; border-radius: px;

div.span: Kassidy Alexander became the second Hanover-Horton bowler to win a state championship Saturday. Kassidy had to qualify for matchplay and then defeated 5 different girls in winning the state championship.

div.p: It is the policy of the Board of Education not to discriminate on the basis of Protected Classes in its educational programs and activities and employment. Protected Classes generally include race, color, national origin, sex (including sexual orientation or transgender identity), disability, age, religion, height, weight, marital status, military status, ancestry, genetic information and such others as are defined in federal or state law. More detailed information can be found in the Board of Education Policies on this website. Inquiries and complaints regarding discrimination in programming and employment may be referred to any of the following: John Denney, Superintendent, 517-563-0100 or Denise Bergstrom, Middle School Principal, 517-563-0102.
